description: From Middle French acoyer, from coy (“quiet, calm”). Equivalent to a- +‎ coy.

verbs.description: accoy (third-person singular simple present accoys, present participle accoying, simple past and past participle accoyed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To soothe, to calm; to assuage, to subdue. [14th–19th c.]
